title: You are here
description: A tour of your close relatives on the tree of life
author: OneZoom

template_data.title: Our family
window_text: This is our family, the great apes, known as Hominids. We are humans and the other great apes are all our cousins. We all share an ancestor - an extinct species, like a great-grandparent who is no longer with us.

template_data.title: Fossils
window_text: On the OneZoom tree we don't currently show fossils, only living species. Living species are not our ancestors. Below you can see some fossil skulls of extinct species of great ape. They will mostly be old counsins rather than direct ancestors but they can still tell a lot about our evolutionary history.

template_data.title: Mammals
window_text: The great apes are part of a much bigger group, the mammals.

window_text.text: There are over 5000 living species of mammal and they share a common ancestor about 180 million years ago. Here is an restoration showing what an ancient extinct mammal 'Juramaia' might have looked like.

template_data.title: Lungfish
window_text: We're more closely related to some fish than others.

window_text.text: Our closest fish relatives are the lungfish. It would be tempting to think that lungs evolved here but actually the first lungs appeared much earlier. The evolution of the lung is a more complicated story that we'll save for another tour.
Let's take a closer look at one of the lungfish

template_data.title: Make a guess
window_text: If there are 5 thousand MAMMAL species, how many species of ANIMAL do you think there are in total?
5 thousand, 14 thousand, 140 thousand, 1.4 million or over 1.4 million?
Press next to find out the answer.

template_data.title: Make a guess: answer
window_text: If there are 5 thousand MAMMAL species, how many species of ANIMAL do you think there are in total?
5 thousand, 14 thousand, 140 thousand, 1.4 million or over 1.4 million?

window_text.text: The answer is... over 1.4 million, meaning only 1 in 300 animal species is a mammal.

template_data.title: Sponges
template_data.window_text: There are even more species of sponges than there are of mammals!

template_data.title: Complete tree
window_text: The complete tree of all known life on earth includes a lot more than just animals!  There are plants, fungi, bacteria, and a host of other weird things that don't fall into any of those groups.

window_text.text: If you spent just two and a half minutes looking at each species, you'd be busy for your entire working life. That's why this tree is a work in progress and scientists are continually making improvements to everything you see here!
